author: sky.cactus
content: In my head, validator client has always been a separate thing from EL/CL.  Geth/Nethermind/Besu/Erigon are Execution Clients, Prysm/Lighthouse/Nimbus/Teku are Consensus Clients.  To use Ethereum you need to run 1 Execution Client and 1 Consensus Client.  To be a validator, you have to both run 1 Execution Client + 1 Consensus Client + 1 Validator Client.

author: sky.cactus
content: One can imagine a bundler in the future that bundles the EL+CL into a single binary/executable package.  In this situation, I would call that bundle an "Ethereum Client", and you may *separately* run a Validator Client (which I wouldn't consider part of an Ethereum Client).

author: ajsutton
content: Prysm/Lighthouse/Nimus/Teku are also all validator clients though.  And in the case of Teku and Nimbus the BN & VC *are* bundled (and can optionally be run separately).

author: timbeiko
content: That's how I think of it FWIW
